summary: This document is an email chain between defense attorney Michael Bachner and an Assistant United States Attorney from the Southern District of New York, discussing scheduling for a 'reverse proffer' meeting and a grand jury appearance for a client (likely Ghislaine Maxwell) in the Epstein investigation. The attorney indicates the client will invoke the Fifth Amendment if called to testify.

persons.name: Michael Bachner
persons.context: Attorney representing a client (likely Ghislaine Maxwell) in the Epstein investigation, communicating with prosecutors to schedule meetings and stating the client will invoke the Fifth Amendment before the grand jury.

persons.name: Andrews
persons.context: Mentioned as attending a meeting with Michael Bachner and the prosecutors; likely a colleague or associate at Bachner's law firm.

connections.description: Andrews is scheduled to attend a meeting with Bachner and the prosecutors, indicating they work together.

events.title: Scheduled Reverse Proffer Meeting
events.description: A reverse proffer meeting was initially scheduled for 6:00 PM at the SDNY office (1 St. Andrew's Plaza) but was later rescheduled.

events.title: Rescheduled Case Conference
events.description: A conference in the case was moved from 9:30 AM to 11:30 AM, as mentioned in an email from 'Shanks'.

events.title: Proposed Meeting Date
events.description: The prosecutor suggested meeting on Thursday afternoon (July 18) for discussions.

events.title: Client Arrest and Arraignment
events.description: Michael Bachner notified prosecutors that a client was arrested and was being arraigned in Queens County on a state RICO charge.

events.title: Fifth Amendment Invocation Notice
events.description: Michael Bachner formally notified prosecutors that if his client were called to testify before the grand jury, she would invoke her Fifth Amendment privilege against self-incrimination.

locations: 1 St. Andrew's Plaza, New York, NY (SDNY Office)
39 Broadway, Suite 1610, New York, NY 10006 (Bachner & Associates office)
keyFacts: Defense attorney Michael Bachner is representing a client (strongly implied to be Ghislaine Maxwell) in the SDNY's Epstein investigation.
Bachner formally notified prosecutors on July 10, 2019, that his client would invoke the Fifth Amendment if called to testify before the grand jury.
The emails center on scheduling a 'reverse proffer' meeting, where prosecutors share evidence with the defense to discuss potential cooperation or plea.
Prosecutors provided Bachner with a copy of Epstein's 2007 non-prosecution agreement and a blank proffer agreement.
The communication reveals active, high-stakes negotiations between the defense and prosecution shortly after Epstein's 2019 arrest.
